body:
I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/c1e0a9efd4</summary>

```php
<?php

$time = (int) round( 1.23 );
sleep( $time );

$time = (int) '123';
sleep( $time );
```

```
Psalm output (using commit 9943efb):

ERROR: ArgumentTypeCoercion - 4:8 - Argument 1 of sleep expects 0|positive-int, parent type int provided

ERROR: ArgumentTypeCoercion - 7:8 - Argument 1 of sleep expects 0|positive-int, parent type int provided
```
</details>

These are two easy issues.

The one with round must be fixed by a return type provider. We already have a few of them, they're easy to create. You can look at https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/6abce3525ac34f815aaa3b7953739b744ca5c39e/src/Psalm/Internal/Provider/ReturnTypeProvider/StrReplaceReturnTypeProvider.php for an example

The one with just the case must be fixed in CastAnalyzer. Most specifically, in this condition:
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/bf993452a874b3d4f1df5175a7d07269e9099e1b/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/Expression/CastAnalyzer.php#L43

Here, we could look at the Union content, if we have a single string and if it's a numeric, we could just cast to int in Psalm and return a literal int with this value instead of returning the generic int

labels.name: easy problems
labels.description: Issues that can be fixed without background knowledge of Psalm

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.title: Try to provide literal int types when possible (fixes #6966)

labels.name: release:feature
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Features' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
This PR fixes vimeo/psalm#6966.

I added a return type provider for the `round` function, which will now try to return a literal `float`, which can then be used for further analysis.
The second change involves modifying the `CastAnalyzer` to also return a literal `int` when possible. I also tried to simplify the code a bit.

body: Half of the issue was resolved

issue.title: Fix invalid casts int and float

labels.name: release:feature
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Features' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
e.g. https://psalm.dev/r/0d284c6f48 gives `Warning: Object of class stdClass could not be converted to int`

Since by default there cannot be any "PossiblyInvalidCasts", as we always get 0/0.0 in error case, added mostly unwanted typecasts that are a leading cause of off-by-one errors as PossiblyInvalidCasts

Fix: https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/issues/6966 (the remaining half + cherry-pick the other half from master to 4.x)

body: Second half has PR created, https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/pull/8366
